intro: Kuala laevis, commonly known as the smooth kuala, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Kuala laevis is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
